docreader.range

Class TitleReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • docreader.range.TitleReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GenericReader<java.lang.Integer>

    public final class TitleReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements GenericReader<java.lang.Integer>
    Reads the very beginning of any requirement document, specifically its title
    Author:
    Moritz Dorka

    • Constructor Detail

      • TitleReader

        public TitleReader(ReaderData readerData,
                   ListReader listReader,
                   RequirementRoot parent,
                   int initialParagraphIndex)
        Ordinary constructor
        Parameters:
        readerData - global readerData
        listReader - used to inject a fake list item for the document title
        parent - title requirement will become child of this
        initialParagraphIndex - number of the first paragraph (0-based, unique for the entire document) where to search for title
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the given parameters is null or out of range

    • Method Detail

      • read

        @DomainSpecific
public java.lang.Integer read()
        Read out the title of this document and return the offset of the first paragraph which is in a list
        Specified by:
        read in interface GenericReader<java.lang.Integer>
        Returns:
        T either an Integer describing how much has been read or nothing (Void)
        See Also:
        GenericReader.read()

      • getTitleRequirement

        public RequirementOrdinary getTitleRequirement()
        Returns:
        the resulting title requirement ready for insertion into the requirement tree
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if read() failed or has not been called yet

      • extractChapterNum

        @DomainSpecific
private void extractChapterNum(java.lang.String titleString,
                                               int lsid)
        Subset-026 specific function to extract the chapter number from the document title
        Parameters:
        titleString - Raw text of the entire title of the document
        lsid - lsid of the list of the first real list item in this document

      • isTitleParagraph

        @DomainSpecific
private boolean isTitleParagraph(int paragraphIndex)
        Checks if a certain paragraph is part of the document title based on the paragraph style it is linked to
        Parameters:
        paragraphIndex - number of the paragraph to check
        Returns:
        true if the paragraph with paragraphIndex is part of the document title; false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the paragraph to check is out of range
